column2: A Christian military order that was founded by a small group of eight wealthy knights. The Poor Fellow-Soldiers of Christ and of the Temple of Solomon - or the Knights Templar for short - have sworn to protect pilgrims traveling through the Holy Land. The order was fully endorsed by the [From.Religion.GetName] church at the council of Troyes, and this will allow pious [From.Religion.GetName] rulers to call on their aid.
The Grand Master of the Knights Templar.

A Christian religious military order, the Order of Knights of the Hospital of Saint John of Jerusalem, are also known as the Knight Hospitaller.\nThe Knights, who have already protected and cared for sick pilgrims in Jerusalem for some time, now have the full weight of the [From.Religion.GetName] Church behind them. Pious [From.Religion.GetName] rulers may call on their support.
The Grand Master of the Knights Hospitaller.

The Order of Brothers of the German House of Saint Mary in Jerusalem was been formed and sponsored by the [From.Religion.GetName] Church and the Holy Roman Emperor. It was assembled from a group of knights originating from the cities of Bremen and Lubeck.  The Teutonic Order, much like the Knights of St. John and the Knights Templar, primarily protect and care for pilgrims to the Holy Land, but will serve any [From.Religion.GetName] ruler willing to pay for their upkeep.
The Grand Master of the Teutonic Order.

The Order of Calatrava is a military branch of the Cistercian, a religious order of monks and nuns. They are soldiers of the Cross, having just been endorsed in a decree issued by the [From.Religion.GetName] Church. These knights take their name from a castle recovered in Iberia from the clutches of the Moslem infidel, and they stand ready to combat heathens and defend the pious in the name of any [From.Religion.GetName] ruler.
The Grand Master of the Order of Calatrava.

This chivalric order, also known as The Order of St. James of the Sword, owes its name to Santiago Matamoros. He was one of the twelve apostles, Saint James the Moorslayer as he is known in other parts of the world. The Order of Santiago enjoys the official sponsorship of the [From.Religion.GetName] Church and its knights have all sworn to purge entire realms of heathens and heretics.
The Grand Master of the Order of Santiago.
The Brotherhood of the Holy Sepulchre

The Brotherhood has worked tirelessly to protect Christian holy sites and relics in the Holy Land ever since it was first founded in 313, when the Edict of Milan legalized Christendom throughout the Roman Empire. This holy order has now become increasingly militarized and their ranks have grown dramatically to include professional soldiers as well. Their dedication to protect the Holy Land has now extended to include the defense of all of [From.Religion.GetName] Christendom.
The Grand Master of the Brotherhood of the Holy Sepulchre.

The Knights of Saint Anthony come from one of the oldest chivalric orders in the world. In 370, disciples of Anthony the Hermit founded the Order of Saint Anthony under the patronage of the Emperor of Ethiopia. Although they have kept a low profile for many centuries, this holy order resurfaced as a powerful force. Their stated purpose is to protect [From.Religion.GetName] Christians from all those who would seek them harm.
The Grand Master of the Brotherhood of the Order of Saint Anthony.

The imperative to protect the Holy Places for [From.Religion.GetName] Christianity has caused the Catholicos, [From.RelHead.GetTitledName], to declare the creation of a holy brotherhood of warrior monks - the Order of Saint Addai, named after the apostle who spread Christianity to Syria and Mesopotamia. They stand ready to smite heathens and infidels and protect the righteous in the name of the [From.Religion.GetName] faith.
The Grand Master of the Brotherhood of the Order of Saint Addai.

A Sufi sect of dervishes founded under the leadership of a certain Hadji Baktash Wali, a mystic from Khorasan. Striving for 'Unity of Being', Bektashis train the soul through meditation and contemplation of the inner meaning of the Koran. The Bektashi Order is warlike and especially popular among [From.Religion.GetName] Muslim soldiers. The Order has sworn to protect Islam and to combat infidels and polytheists of all kinds.
The Grand Master of the Brotherhood of the Bektashi Order.

They call themselves simply 'The Haruriyyah'. An order of Muslim warriors, claiming descent from the old Haruri traditions and swearing to protect Islam and combat infidels and polytheists of all kinds. It was a Haruri who killed the Caliph Ali with a poisoned sword since they saw him as corrupting Islam, and this group vows to show the same courage and determination in fighting any enemies of the true faith.
The Grand Master of the Haruriyyah.

A holy order modeled after the ancient Zealots to protect Judaism against its enemies. Just like the Jewish sect that is their namesake, these Zealots will not shy away from violence against those they feel are deserving. Some within the [From.Religion.GetName] religious community have accused the Zealots of taking their faith to extreme levels, but the ranks of the order continue to swell as [From.Religion.GetName] exiles returning to the Promised Land flock to their banner.
The Grand Master of the Zealots.

A holy order founded by some of Persia's finest warriors who have taken it upon themselves to safeguarding the [From.Religion.GetName] faith. They call themselves the Immortals, just like the ancient Persian warrior elite described by Herodotus, and they seem intent on carrying on the martial traditions of their legendary predecessors. This militant holy order has sworn to fight against all who would threaten the legacy of Zoroaster.
The Grand Master of the Immortals.

A warrior brotherhood along the Baltic coast that was established by band of fierce Vikings. Based in a castle known as Jomsborg, these Jomsvikings are devoted to Thor, Odin and the other Norse gods. They brook no quarter on the battlefield and will permit only the strongest and ablest warriors amongst their number.\nThough there are those who would dismiss them as simple brigands, the Jomsvikings have vowed to defend all Norse lands being encroached by Christendom or other foreign religions.
The Grand Master of the Jomsvikings.

The mighty Sky-Father of the Tengri faith is all-seeing, but still has need of human instruments on the ground. The Lords of the Sky, a holy order founded in the wake of the Tengri Reformation, ride to do battle against infidels and to spread the will of the Sky-Father to all corners of the world. The deafening sound of these knights approaching on their mounts is like thunder in the sky, and the noise alone is rumored to have made some convert to the Tengri religion on the spot.
The Grand Master of the Lords of the Sky.

With the reformation of the many West African pagan belief systems into a single coherent whole, several tribes have agreed to pool together their best warriors into a single holy order. They claim to be the Guardians of the Spirits and they have vowed to defend the spirits and those who believe in them from all who would do them harm.
The Grand Master of the Spirit Guardians.

The reformation of the Slavic faith has led to a religious fervor throughout the lands of the Slavs the likes of which has never been seen before. Many of the greatest champions have come together to form this Slavic holy order. They call themselves the Warriors of Perun, the god of thunder, and have all taken vows to defend the Slavic faith and its believers to their dying breaths.
The Grand Master of the Warriors of Perun.

When the Romuvan religion was reformed to better face the modern world, several champions had stepped forward, claiming that Perkunas, the god of thunder, has has willed them to join the holy order. The Chosen of Perkunas, as they call themselves, have sworn to defend the Romuvan faith and to direct the wrath of the gods towards the skulls of their enemies.
The Grand Master of the Chosen of Perkunas.

A Finnish holy order, dedicated to the preservation and defense of the reformed Suomenusko religion. These warriors call themselves the 'Sons of Kaleva' and they are prepared to march into battle against all those who would deny the truth of their faith. Many Finns look upon them as the heroes of their ancient myths, and they seem to have no shortage of recruits.
The Grand Master of the Sons of Kaleva.

The Easterners across the sea have more religions than a parrot has feathers, but the Aztec faith has been reformed and reorganized to better stand against the heathens. The Cult of Huitzilopochtli was founded by several warrior-priests devoted to the Aztec deity of war. This cult is bent on the forceful conversion of the world, preferably with lots of human sacrifice in the process.
The Grand Master of the Cult of Huitzilopochtli.

Ashoka Maurya, one of India greatest emperor, ruled almost all of the Indian subcontinent before witnessing how much deaths his wars brought. He then embraced Buddhism shortly and became a stable and peaceful emperor. The Chosen of Ashoka is an order that follow their patron examples. They act as avatars of vengeance, showing retribution to those threatening the peace of their fellow Buddhist and their presences bring stability to Buddhist realms.
The Grand Master of the Chosen of Ashoka.

The Followers of Arjuna is a holy order dedicated to following in the prowess of Arjuna, of stainless deeds, the third Pandava brother. Arjuna was very virtuous and famous among the gods but this was second to his supreme mastery of weapons, including almost all divine, celestial and esoteric weapons. The Followers aim to rival such perfections and will fight any enemy of Hinduism to improve their skills and receive the gods favors.
The Grand Master of the Followers of Arjuna.

The Bulls of Rishabha are dedicated to Rishabhanatha, the founder of Jainism. He was the first of the twenty four tirthankara to attain omniscience and end his cycle of births and deaths.\nThe members of the holy order are sworn to protect his teachings, the basis of their social system that created the varna casts, against infidels who have stolen his knowledge and using it against them.
The Grand Master of the Bulls of Rishabha.

A holy order that was founded for the defense and preservation of the reformed and expanding Zunist religion. They call themselves 'Knights of the Sun' and are sworn to stand steadfast in battle, protect the faithful and help spread the light of Zun the Justice-Giver to new lands. Many young warriors are flocking to their golden standard.
The Grand Master of the Knights of the Sun.

The Manichaean faith has always been a sort of choir sung by the prominent figures of other religions like Jesus, Zoroaster or Buddha. Taking parts of each beliefs to form an unified whole. However, this is seen as a great heresy by all the infidels, who will not hesitate to kills and purge all trace of Manichaeism. The Army of Light will protect the spiritual world from the heathen, who live in the darkness created by their greed.
The Grand Master of the Army of Light.

Taking some inspirations from the knights of the round table of yore, with less focus on the holy quest and more on personal prestige and honor, this fighters guilds is the pride of the western world. Young knights come from all corners to join them in their quest for Glory!\nTheir skills are greatly solicited, be it for military advice or bounty hunting.
The Champion of the Round Table.

Travelers can sometime see massive circles dug into the dunes. One may think they are but dried oasis, but they'll only find blood soaked sand. These sandpits are the arenas in which the members of this fighters guilds bet their lives for Glory. They will not hesitate to cut down heads for money and will provide their martial services to anyone to improve their prestige. Few can stand unfazed in front of these children of the sands.

Be it for tradition or the favors of their gods, warriors have always solved their conflicts by spilling the blood of unworthy parties. Only the mightiest can ever hope to stand in the ring of honor without meeting a swift death. These brave heroes will do everything they can to improve themselves even further and make their legends the greatest by felling the strongest of foes.
The Champion of the Ring of Honor.
The Wheel of Life and Death

Various people believe in some form of rebirth. While their goals is usually to put an end to it, there are others who much prefer this mortal plane where they can perpetually improve themselves in mind and body. These fighters are well known for their combat abilities and knowledge of war, they are often relied upon by lords for various tasks.\nThere are rumors that some members have spent several lives in the organization.
The Champion of the Wheel of Life and Death.
The Livonian Brothers of the Sword

Organized by a Livonian Bishop, the Livonian Brothers of the Sword is a [From.Religion.GetName] military order comprised mostly of german monk warriors. Their role is to help in the conversion of the local pagans and to see to the protection of the [From.Religion.GetName] Baltic provinces. Not specially keep on their vassalage to the bishops, they are ready to help [From.Religion.GetName] any ruler against the infidels and pagans.
The Grand Master of the Teutonic Order.

The order was founded to stem the tide of infidels and heretics bearing down upon the innocent faithful. They were originally a small army of Armenian soldiers and clerics that had banded together under the banner of Saint Blaise. With the Latins and Greeks pushing from the west and the Muslims from the East, there is very little these men have aside from unshakeable faith in the power of God to stand between them and their enemies.
The Grand Master of the Order of St. Blaise.

The Knights of Saint Mark have arisen to preserve the Coptic populations scattered throughout Egypt and Abyssinia in order the protect the oppressed faithful from the iron scepter of Muslim domination and the encroachment of the schismatics. Tales abound of their courage and tenacity, even against innumerably greater odds.
The Grand Master of the Knights of Saint Mark.

An army made out of a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen banded together. An order that has, much to the shock of Christians elsewhere in the world, taken as its patron saint none other than Lucifer the Lighbringer, greatest of the Archangels and the King of Hell. Lucifer, they believe, is no more than an agent of chaos and change, and in His name they intend to bring about a change in the world. They will drive the demons of sin from the ranks of humanity with the force of their arms.
The Grand Master of the Army of Lucifer.

A military order bearing the name of the Arsiyah formed by a group of Khazars. Originally mercenaries in service to the Khazar Khaganate, the Arsiyah were sworn never to fight fellow Muslims and formed an important part of the Khazar military. This reborn order is ever ready to serve [From.Religion.GetName] lords against their religious enemies.
The Grand Master of the Arsiyah.

It was a pious former slave who had formed this group of his previous brethren into a military order dedicated to protecting [From.Religion.GetName] people from infidels and other religious enemies. They have named their order the Saqaliba, a term applied to slaves taken from eastern Europe and a fitting title for a group consisting of the very same.
The Grand Master of the Saqaliba.
The Devotees of the True Prophet
Tell me of you see this in game.
The Grand Master of the Devotees of the True Prophet.

Harkening back to the early days of Islam, the Ansar have adopted the name given to Muhammad's first allies in Medina, who helped the Prophet's companions in the war against the Quraysh. Like the original Ansar, these holy warriors will assist the leaders of [From.Religion.GetName] Islam in spreading the religion of God, by sword if need be.

The Ghazis are mercenary organizations that often practiced raiding and looting when they are not under the direct command of a Muslim state. The Ghazis are not an united order but several corporations of warriors, the only major difference between them is which sect of Islam the group follow. They are considered prestigious and attract adventurers, zealots and religious and political dissidents of all ethnicities.
The Grand Master of the Ghazis.

The Ghazis are mercenary organizations that often practiced raiding and looting when they are not under the direct command of a Muslim state. The Ghazis are not an united order but several corporations of warriors, the only major difference between them is which sect of Islam the group follow. They are considered prestigious and attract adventurers, zealots and religious and political dissidents of all ethnicities.
The Grand Master of the Ghazis.

With the restoration of the rightful borders of the Jewish Kingdom of Israel, proper forces is be required to protect it from the Muslim and Christian invaders who want the holy city for themselves. The Guardian of the Temple is a new Holy Military Order whose charge is the protection of Jerusalem and of the Jewish people. Never again shall the sons of Judea be evicted from their home.
The Grand Master of the Guardians of the Temple.

The Foest Braedralag was until now a sacred honor pact between two warriors, if one were to die a violent death, the other would be sworn to vengeance. With time the Norsemen would create bigger pacts of mutual assistance, under the protection of the Gods of Asgard. They are now sworn to protect all the children of the AllFather and to avenge any misdeed against the Norse faith.
The Grand Master of the Braedralag.

These men, whose bodies and shields are dyed in black, were the terror of the north-eastern roman border. Stalking the night, they would ambush their enemies with screams from the blackest corners and cut them down with impunity. With the consolidation of the power within the Germanic faith and the renewed threats from the heathens, this shadowy army was reborn to protect the remaining Irminsuls and the germanic borders once again.
The Grand Master of the Harii.

The Fianna are a sacred band of warriors loyal only to the Druids and to the Gods, dressed in wolf skins over mail and venerating the famed warriors Fionn and Cuchullain.\nThis warband are not only a powerful shock force against the isle's many enemies, but also channel the fiery spirits of the younger, restless sons of the Éire.
The Grand Master of the Fianna.

The Sons of Gwydion are a sacred order of warriors loyal only to the Druids and their Circle, dressed in wolf skins over mail and venerating the famed trickster Gwydion.\nThis Order are not only a powerful shock force against Britain's many enemies, but also channel the fiery spirits of the younger, restless sons of Britain.
The Grand Master of the Sons of Gwydion.

Up till now the Red Dragon Knights have contented themselves with keeping safe the high ways and guarding the holy places of the druidic faith. This band of warriors now dedicated themselves to the protection of innocent druidic peoples everywhere. The Red Dragon Knights shall raise their banners for any druidic ruler at war with infidels, but won't fight their brothers and sisters in the faith.
The Grand Master of the Red Dragon Knights.

The Anubis Guards are warriors atop chariots equipped with bow and arrow alongside fearsome spear troops. They don helmets in the shape of the old god of the dead, Anubis, to whom they seek to gift their enemies as offering so that he may judge their souls, certainly to be devoured by Ammit. This [From.Religion.GetName] holy order pose a serious threat to all that oppose Kemetism and strike fear in the heart of the enemies of Egypt.
The Grand Master of the Anubis Guard.

Following the ongoing success of the Anubis guard, the Pharaohate created another [From.Religion.GetName] holy order. This time it us under the protection of the tutelary deity itself, Horus. With the blessing of the god of kingship and the sky, the Horusian Guard is ready to defend the Egyptian empire from all heathens and heretics that would dare threaten it.
The Grand Master of the Horusian Guard.

We have founded the Herculeans, an order of [From.Religion.GetName] warriors devoted to Hercules, the mightiest of the heroes. They tirelessly seek to emulate his exploits and battle against the followers of the Judean and Arabian prophets. No longer shall the followers of the ancient [From.Religion.GetName] faith bow their heads before foreign gods!
The Grand Master of the Herculeans.

The Sacred Band are a reformed brotherhood of soldiers noted for their stalwart discipline and unwavering resolution, the original band had vanished over a thousand years ago. They were an elite corps of 150 pairs of male lovers, formed with men of all social class. The members of this reborn order have sworn to never rest until the Gods of Olympus are granted the respect they are due
The Grand Master of the Sacred Band.

The Great Tengri Host, an army of armies, with as many warriors as there is blades of grass in the steppes. The host is ever getting ready for the time that a Great Khan would rise and unite the hordes, leading them to glory. Until the time is right, the Great Host allow a very small subset their armies to gain experiences while helping any Tengri rulers in need of help against their common enemies
The Grand Master of the Great Host.
The Guardians of the Sacred Flame

Romuva Temple is the most sacred place of the Romuvan faith. It is well hidden and house the sacred flame and an evergreen oak, protected by the Kriwe and its loyal guards for centuries. The guards spent their life keeping the temple's location a secret, only the most dedicated warriors were chosen for the task and they will gladly help Romuvan rulers to sharpen their skills against those who pose a threat to their faith.
The Grand Master of the Guardians of the Sacred Flame.
The Disciples of the Old Gods

One of the points that distinct the Finnish faith from the other Nordic Pagans is its strong ties to nature. Most of its gods are related to an aspect of nature and they have a strong animist side about local nature deities. The Disciples protect these local deities, their shrines being much smaller and easily forgotten, assuring that they still receive the respect they deserve. They will help any ruler of the Suomenusko who's territories is menaced by infidels.
The Grand Master of the Disciples of the Old Gods.

column2: The [chivalry_holy_society_one_name.GetName] is a military monastic order, created to protect the [From.Religion.GetName] faith and its people. Peasants, Knights and even Kings will join this holy fellowship to help against the ever-increasing infidel threat creeping from beyond our borders and from within.

Men and women from all around the world gather in this guild to prove their might and mettle. They seek to improve their fame and become renowed champions through trials and duels which may cost them their lives.
The Champion of the Warriors Guild.

The Berserkers are people who have either nothing to lose or were judged too dangerous by the Warriors Guild to join their ranks. They fight recklessly and are a threat to their own life and to anyone who faces them, making them some of the most dangerous foes in the land. They tend to have more glorious lives than most, albeit shorter ones, too.

No one is sure whether they are the Amazons of legends or simply a sect of women seeking to improve their martial might who took their mantles.\nTheir skills in combat can rival those of any men, so underestimating them is a grave mistake.

The most pious followers of their religion might join Holy Orders in an attempt to defend the faith from outside forces. Coming to the defense of any Lord or Lady who might be attacked by infidels, they are the stalwart protectors of the faithful. These orders have strict hierarchies, passing from one leader to the next within the order.
column3: Les fidèles les plus pieux peuvent rejoindre les ordres sacrés de leur religion afin de tenter de défendre les seigneurs ou dames attaqués par les infidèles. Ces ordres ont des hiérarchies strictes et passent d'un chef à l'autre au sein de l'ordre.
column4: Die frommsten Anhänger ihrer Religion können sich den Ritterorden anschließen, um den Glauben vor äußeren Einwirkungen zu schützen. Sie kommen zur Verteidigung eines jeden Fürsten oder Fürstin, die von Ungläubigen angegriffen werden und sind damit die unerschütterlichen Beschützer der Gläubigen. Diese Orden haben strenge Hierarchien und die Herrschaft wechselt nach Reihenfolge.
column6: Los seguidores más piadosos de una religión podrían unirse a las órdenes sagradas buscando de defender la fe contra fuerzas externas. En defensa de todo señor o señora que pueda ser atacado por infieles, son los defensores incondicionales de los fieles. Estas órdenes tienen jerarquías estrictas, que pasan de un líder a otro dentro de la orden.

Due to its lack of divine right to rule, it is not as stable as a feudal realm and it lacks the religious legitimacy of the Holy Orders, so bribes and and ruling with an iron fist are necessary to keep control. They receive most of their income from their work as mercenaries and from the tributes of their vassals.
